Others: Kristaps Porzingis returned to the court after missing four straight games with an ankle sprain.
Porzingis recorded 11 points, 5 rebounds, 2 assists, and 2 blocks in a 109-86 win over the Houston Rockets.
Porzingis missed the first 17 games due to an offseason ankle surgery before returning in late November.
Porzingis' ankle sprain was on the same ankle as the one he had surgery on.
Porzingis is averaging 17.7 points, 6.3 rebounds, 1.7 assists, and 1.5 blocks on 44.9/34.3/84.2 shooting splits.
Porzingis' numbers are slightly down from last season.
Porzingis' defensive impact has been significant, especially against the Rockets.
Porzingis is defending 17.6 field goals per game, which is the most on the team.
Porzingis has a 47.9 defensive field goal percentage.
Since Porzingis’ return, the Celtics’ paint defense has improved from 26th to 4th.
Porzingis ranks in the 91st percentile for offensive plus/minus and 86th percentile for defensive plus/minus.
